div.div: The defeat of 2012 is forcing Republicans to rethink what they stand for. What will the new conservatism look like?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZpqqL7&via=Digg&text=The GOP's Comeback Plan

div.a: This Dubbed Delta Safety Video Is F*cking Hilarious

div.div: This deliciously absurd parody of Delta Airline's safety video starts a bit slow, but it skyrockets into laughing my underpants off altitude in a few seconds. Please, you watch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T3zymO&via=Digg&text=This Dubbed Delta Safety Video Is F*cking Hilarious

div.a: Why Aren't We All Using Japanese Toilets?

div.div: Why on earth would you use your hand and paper when a machine can pleasantly and perfectly wash your bum? These exquisite toilets are everywhere in Japan and yet can barely be found in the United States.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/THwef0&via=Digg&text=Why Aren't We All Using Japanese Toilets?

div.div: HOW DID HE GET TOM CRUISE TO LOOK NORMAL?

div.a: How Steven Spielberg’s Cinematographer Got These Eleven Shots

div.div: What better time to talk to Janusz Kaminskiabout about how he managed to create some of the most interesting shots and sequences in Spielberg's modern ouevre?

div.a: Burger King Japan Introduces All-You-Can-Eat Burgers & Fries

div.div: An all-you-can-eat Burger King sounds like dangerous fast-food insanity. (Un)Fortunately, Burger King Japan seems to think that unlimited burgers and fries are just the thing to celebrate their fifth anniversary in Japan.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UHpNal&via=Digg&text=Burger King Japan Introduces All-You-Can-Eat Burgers & Fries

div.div: LEAVE THE FIGHTING TO THE PROFESSIONALS

div.a: Here’s Real-Life Superhero Phoenix Jones Knocking A Racist Out

div.div: Phoenix Jones is an undefeated professional MMA fighter. Clearly, this racist did not recognize him before challenging him to a fight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UGB8HV&via=Digg&text=Here’s Real-Life Superhero Phoenix Jones Knocking A Racist Out

div.a: Every Law & Order Verdict In Charts

div.div: Law & Order is analyzed by two separate yet equally important groups: the people who watch the show and send in the data, and the people who build the spreadsheets. These are their findings…

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Um2keq&via=Digg&text=Every Law & Order Verdict In Charts

div.div: Samsung’s recent success in mobile phones has been spectacular. It went from having almost no smartphone sales to selling over 50 million units per quarter in a matter of two years.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UoIsat&via=Digg&text=Google Vs. Samsung

div.a: 5-Hour Energy Is Cited In 13 Death Reports

div.div: Federal officials have received reports of 13 deaths over the last four years that cited the possible involvement of 5-Hour Energy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T3DLqH&via=Digg&text=5-Hour Energy Is Cited In 13 Death Reports

div.div: WHERE'S THE REAL-LIFE VIGO THE CARPATHIAN?

div.a: Man Finds His Doppelganger At The Philadelphia Museum Of Art

div.div: The painting, “Portrait of a Nobleman with Duelling Gauntlet” (1562) by an anonymous artist, has an uncanny resemblance to the young man and the hundreds of comments on Reddit attest to it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XCUjIw&via=Digg&text=Man Finds His Doppelganger At The Philadelphia Museum Of Art

div.a: The Rise And Fall Of Stalin's Atlantis

div.div: In the 1950s, Soviet engineers built a massive city in the Caspian Sea off the coast of Azerbaijan. It was a network of oil platforms linked by hundreds of kilometers of roads and housing 5,000 workers, with a cinema, a park and apartment blocks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X6Xr0y&via=Digg&text=The Rise And Fall Of Stalin's Atlantis

div.a: Google Named 2nd Best Company To Work For In The World

div.div: Google is the second best company to work for across the world, at least in the opinion of CNNMoney.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SMinmi&via=Digg&text=Google Named 2nd Best Company To Work For In The World

div.a: How To Email Your Family After You Die

div.div: Canadian entrepreneur Tom Jackson's new service, NowSayIt, helps you prepare for an unexpected, accidental death by recording and storing messages, videos, and more for loved ones left behind.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SM7Xmu&via=Digg&text=How To Email Your Family After You Die

div.div: While lots of states are hopping on the Secession bandwagon now, threats to leave the Union have long been made in the United States, but rarely followed through on.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UDBzYW&via=Digg&text=10 Facts About Secession

div.a: Petraeus Mistress Had Substantial Classified Data On Her Computer

div.div: A computer used by Paula Broadwell, the woman whose affair with CIA director General David Petraeus led to his resignation, contained substantial classified information that should have been stored under more secure conditions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W6ZJGI&via=Digg&text=Petraeus Mistress Had Substantial Classified Data On Her Computer

div.div: ARE WE SURE HE WASN'T A VAMPIRE HUNTER?

div.a: How Abraham Lincoln Developed Modern War Technology

div.div: With the release of a new feature film about the nation's 16th president, we revisit a 1957 PopSci article on Lincoln's heroic efforts to modernize the science of war.

div.a: If It Didn’t Happen On Twitter It Didn’t Really Happen. Here’s Why
